item.title: Land snails and slugs
item.description:
Land molluscs are my main group of expertise. I use them as models in dispersal ecology, to study the causes and consequences of individual behaviour differences (or “personalities”) and to understand the impacts of urbanization.

I work mostly with the common land snails Cornu aspersum and Cepaea nemoralis, but have handled 20 other species of land molluscs in the lab.

item.title: Spiders
item.description:
I study orb weavers (primarily Araneidae), as their webs are great integrators of their foraging strategies in response to environmental changes.

I also use money spiders (fam. Linyphiidae, especially Erigone sp.) as models to study the evolution of dispersal and integrated phenotypes.
